news_header: Kayaker Adrián Simancas was accidentally engulfed by a humpback whale while paddling in the Strait of Magellan. After a brief moment of panic, he was spat back out unharmed.
news_original_title: 'I felt a slimy texture brush my face': Man describes being swallowed by whale
news_text: His father captured the incident on video, revealing the whale's enormous size. Experts explained that humpback whales cannot swallow large objects like kayaks, suggesting the encounter was accidental. Adrián viewed the experience as a 'second chance' and a reminder to appreciate life.
